intro: Althaea meonantha, commonly known as the creeping marshmallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen, blooming in late summer. Althaea meonantha thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
